snippet: Donald L. Blankenship was accused of looking away from hundreds of safety violations to produce more coal while avoiding the cost of following safety laws.
abstract: Donald L Blankenship, former chief executive of Massey Energy Company, is charged in 43-page indictment with widespread criminal violations of mining safety rules and deceiving federal inspectors; firm was involved in nation's worst coal mine disaster in 40 years, in which 29 men died in explosion at Upper Big Branch mine near Montcoal, W Va, in 2010; Blankenship faces a maximum of 31 years in prison.
lead_paragraph: Donald L. Blankenship was accused of looking away from hundreds of safety violations to produce more coal while avoiding the cost of following safety laws.

headline.main: Ex-Executive Donald Blankenship Is Indicted in Disaster at Coal Mine
headline.print_headline: Ex-Executive Is Indicted in Disaster at Coal Mine
